column14: Struck a mountain in poor weather
While attempting to make an emergency landing on the Minam river the plane hit a bolder killing the pilot
Diverted off Kerkira in the Ionian Sea, in thunderstoms and high seas and sank.
While attempting to land, the aircraft overran the runway and hit the perimeter fence.
Crashed into the sea. Reasons unknown.

The plane was making the last of a number of sightseeing flights when one of its three engines failed. The Plane went out of control at an altitude of 200 ft. and crashed into a railroad freight car. Engine failure followed by a stall during an emergency landing attempt.

The aircraft crashed into a high mountain ridge, exploding on impact. Investigators speculated that upon encountering fog and winds in the treacherous mountain pass, the pilot may have turned the airliner around and was heading back to the airport when the crash occurred.

column3: Maddux Airlines / Military - U.S.Army Air Force
column14: A midair collision occurredwith a US Air Force Boeing PW-9D at 2,000 ft.Five killed on the Tri-motor, one on the Boeing. Army pilot Lieutenant Howard Keefer, while flying above the airliner, was stunting and performed a steep banking turn downward, in an attempt to pass in front of the airliner. Instead, he misjudged the speed of the Maddux aircraft and his diving plane struck the cockpit of the Ford Tri-motor.He was found criminally negligent.
An engine failed, the plane stalled and crashed.
A wing separated in flight and the plane crashed.
The plane collided with a submerged object while taking off.
Crashed while taking off. The muddy field prevented the aircraft from gaining altitude. The plane hit telephone wires and crashed.
Took off, lost power and altitude and crashed into a telegraph tower.

The plane was over the English Channel, approximately 3 miles offshore, when an engine failed due to the failure of a connecting rod on a cylinder.. The pilot tried to return to the airport but the plane ditched into the English Channel. The plane was named City of Ottawa.
Crashed near Indian Mounds park shortly after taking off. Triple engine failure.
The aircraft crashed into lake Constance while attempting to landing. The landing was hard and the plane broke in two.
The mail plane crashed in fog and low visibility and burned.
The just manufactured aircraft was on its way to be delivered to its new owne rwithfour employees of Lockheed,two pilots and two engineers when it crashed under unknown circumstances.
Hit terrain in low visibility.
Crashed under unknown circumstances.
The plane crashed after going into a tail spin in a thunderstorm. The mechanic was able to parachute to safety.

column2: Mt. Taylor, near Grants, New Mexico
column14: Crashed into a mountain in thunderstorms. The plane was named The City of San Francisco.
Crashed short of the runway in low visibility and at night.
Crashed at sea, 30 miles from Larache, Morocco.
The aircraft went out of control and crashed
The mail plane crashed into Mt. Lamentation in fog and burst into flames.
The mail plane crashed into a hillside in the desert while attempting to make an emergency landing during a storm.
Crashed into the Mediterranean.
The aircraft ditched in the ocean after encountering gale force winds. Sank while in tow. The plane was named City of Rome.
The mail plane crashed into a grove of trees 8 miles southwest of Mount Vernon in foggy conditons.

column3: Bremerton-Seattle Air Taxi / Gorst Air Lines
column14: The air taxi crashed into Puget Sound as it attempted to take off.
The mail plane crashed in dense fog.
After the planes antenna wire struck the ground and was partially torn off, the pilot attempted to return to land but crashed in rain and fog.
Crashed into the Mediterranean in fog. No trace of the plane was ever found.
The plane crashed due toan optical phenomenon caused by calm waters and an erroneous height assessment.
The mail plane crashed into a fog bound tower of the interstate bridge spanning the Columbia River.
The mail plane crashed en route during a storm.
Pilot lost his bearing in fog and crashed.
Crashed onto a golf coursewhile on approach during a demonstration flight.
